alert.note: Alert for Central Washington; Coastal Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 3:49PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Washington County through 430 PM EDT... At 349 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Calais, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Calais, Perry, Pembroke, Meddybemps, Robbinston, Dennysville, Charlotte, Baring and Edmunds. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 between Dennysville and Perry. State Highway 9 near Baring. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
